Posts.Content: Hi, I am the same but have only been on the letrozole for a couple of months and I am already like a 100 year old! The district nurse who comes to give my Herceptin injections was so concerned she made an appointment for me to see onc on the 6th Dec as I want to give it up.Have already told them am not having the zoladronic acid so will try and find out what the percentage for me is.... as said before would rather have quality of life. Starting rads on 8th Dec and apart from the further Herceptin injections that is it for me. xx
Posts.Title: Choosing whether to continue into another five years of hormone t...

Posts.Content: Hi, sorry for jumping in on your thread but something jowoomot said hit a chord with me. It was the word recognition. It's what I think I was looking for but didn't know until I read this. At the time of treatment I really didn't want it, all the 'you're brave, be strong' stuff really got on my nerves, but now all the treatments have finished it's like everyone has brushed it to one side as if it never happened. Sometimes I don't want people to know I've had cancer (especially strangers) other times, especially when I see or hear people doing something petty, I want to shout at them 'get a life' it's too short. I don't want people to fawn over me but I want them to recognise I'm never going to be the old me... a brush with death changes things. As for the 'filters' I've never had them! All my life I've said what I think (got me in trouble at times lol). Now I've got extra with the old age non-filter so I'm twice as lethal. Good luck to you all, be selfish you earned it. xx
Posts.Title: Restless and feeling guilty about it

Posts.Content: Hello Everyone, I am not new on here but I removed myself from the site because I went into a dark place. Sounds silly but it was after I had been told that I had a 'complete pathological response' ( no sign of tumour after chemo) and no trace of anything to remove in my lumpectomy.I still have radiotherapy to go (8th Dec for 15 sessions) and 3 weekly Herceptin injections for a year.I have refused letrozole and any biophosphonates. So why then did I suddenly start crying and having panic attacks? My family (bless them) said I should be celebrating now I am cured and back to normal....well we all know what we think of that! I couldn't stay in my house,I couldn't be with people but then I needed people but who needs someone who cries at a smile or kindness. I was so bad one day I went back to the hospital and sat outside the Macmillan office crying.They sent for my BCN who arrived with a clinical psychologist. I didn't care I just wanted the crying and panic attacks to stop.She actually told me it was normal! Then told me they were very good at treating cancer but were useless afterwards, but research had been done and a new after-care service had started and I was an ideal candidate.They phoned my gp and got him to prescribe anti-depressants and also diazepam for 2 weeks. I have had 3 sessions with her so far and believe me I never knew what things I had been brooding on (some stupid things too).She said I had been putting on a 'good' face' even the BCN said I was the last person she thought she would see like this as I had been so strong even when really ill with sepsis etc. I have stopped the diazepam now but it did help me to sleep and the anti depressants seem to have kicked in..plus I had a good talk to the family and finally told them how I felt. I need to get out more but my 'friends' seem to have all emigrated.Before all this I booked a holiday for between op and rads...guess who with.....Monarch... who went bust but at least I got my money back lol. Sorry for the essay but just think that more needs to be said and done about our mental health too. Love to you all xx
Posts.Title: Mental Health side effects

Posts.Content: Hi, I am almost on the same timescale as your sister. Diagnosed in May I have had 3 Fec so far and having 4 Herceptin/perjeta/docetaxol first one on the 11th august.Then surgery and rads. My oncologist told me there would be at least a 4 week break after chemo before surgery to get some strength back. I do have a date for surgery(providing everything goes to plan) 15th November so I am hoping to get a weekend away (uk) before then, but I am not booking anything as we all know how things can change, I am just taking it day by day and if I can't get away now will do it next year. It's my 65th birthday on 10th august (yes day before chemo) and not doing anything party wise as when the treatment is all over we are going to have one whale of a time! Keep on being strong for your sister but look after yourself too. xx
Posts.Title: My sister. needs postive messages from people who are in the same...

Posts.Content: Hi Optimistic, sorry there is no room for you in the dark place ..... I have thrown the key away to that door and none of us are going there! We might knock and bang on it but we are NOT going in we are coming here instead! Even at my lowest points I looked at the photos on Awake thread and laughed. I looked at photos and videos of my grand-daughter and laughed. We all have our fears and I hope you have a good counsellor as mine has helped me to face my fears big time. You are never alone... took me ages to realise this and definitely it's better to talk about your fears and put them in perspective. When I said some to my psycho(lol) I love to call her that ...when she answered back it was like a light bulb moment. We can't change the past or know the future but we sure as hell can live for now. Love to youÂ  xx
Posts.Title: Mental Health side effects

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone, Sorry for bumping this thread back but I just read a blog on here about Life after Treatment being taken to Parliament and I wanted us all if we can to get behind this campaign the same as we do for new drugs etc. As for myself you've probably noticed (and been bored) that I am back.. I won't say to normal as I've forgotten what normal is! I do feel so much better and the psycho has definitely helped... the funny thing is I was never afraid to speak my mind before diagnosis,especially to family and then I became a mouse, too fatigued to care but obviously keeping all the anger and annoyance in.. she told me don't do it..tell them straight away how you feel and now I do. Or let it go in one ear and out the other and think of myself. I am now a little stronger, bit more selfish, but number one is now first in my book. Take care all and do read the blog. xx
Posts.Title: Mental Health side effects

Posts.Content: Hi All, Once again I have no apologies for bumping up this thread. Mainly because so many of the new threads seem to be about anxiety and depression. I have gone from the dark place to a new understanding of me.Yes I still have issues in the way I am treated ,mainly by the family who love me but can't seem to see the whole picture. I just wanted to let all the new or old people on here know that it does get better. I suddenly even today ,months after treatment has finished realised I've won the battle for now.. I was walking down the road today and suddenly thought I've beaten you now you breast cancer bastard..where that came from. .no idea. .but it felt good. I have been in touch with my MP to see what we can do for the future..as was said to me 'we are so good at treating cancer but not good at the after effects'. I just hope I can give a little assurance to all the new people on this rollercoaster that it does slow down and get better. Love to you all. xx
Posts.Title: Mental Health side effects

Posts.Content: Hi All, I was wondering if anyone has any advice on what to do. My passport is due for renewal and although I probably won't be using it until about February 2018, after all my treatment is over, I will have to get a photo taken now. I am bald, do I have the picture taken like this but then will have it on my passport for 10 years . I do have a wig but never wear it...would it be classed as deceptive to get photo done with it on? I have looked on the govuk website and there is no information there. Has anyone had this problem? Any advice will be appreciated. xx
Posts.Title: Passport Photo

Posts.Content: Hi everyone and thanks for your replies. I have phoned the passport office and after consulting with someone as she didn't know the answer she came back with ....'the Passport Office mainly use facial recognition technology so you can either wear a wig or be bald (unless your facial features have changed). However, other countries may look at the photo,see the hair(wig) and may query it if you are bald. So our advice would be,even if you don't wear it after the photo,to take the same wig with you to prevent any difficulty.' She said she had never had anyone ask this before so it can't be a problem as such. Thanks again for your help. xx
Posts.Title: Passport Photo

Posts.Content: Oh Shirl please do the rads.It's a walk in the park compared to chemo. I was like you very bad with chemo, admitted twice with sepsis and thought I couldn't face rads, but I thought kill all the little stray buggers that might be left.It was tiring more than anything having to go everyday..I had to go in ambulance transport everyday but the people I met kept me going and I've said it here before we had a bunch of flowers everyday for free in the rads dept.which was lovely and boosted spirits. I went for a sleep each day when I got home, all my appointments were at the same time in the morning,ask your rads dept if they can do that for you.I found it better as I knew where I was and how the day spanned out. I hope you can get something sorted but please..you've done the tough bit so just finish off the buggers. Keep in touch and pm me if you need to. xx
Posts.Title: Anyone refused radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Sorry for the late reply ladies, been granny napping too much!Â  I'm not going to put anything on before just in case then wait and see what they say. Thanks for all the replies I'll let you know what happens. xx
Posts.Title: â¢â¢â¢ December Radiotherapy Club â¢â¢â¢

Posts.Content: Hi All, Went for my 2nd session today and it was a joy. Everyone was given a bunch of flowers, there were mince pies and chocolates every where to help yourself and best of all a school choir were there singing carols, they were brilliant but one girl in particular had the most beautiful voice I've ever heard. The sessions were running half hour late but who cared! I sat there,closed my eyes and forgot all my woes it was like a complimentary therapy. xx
Posts.Title: â¢â¢â¢ December Radiotherapy Club â¢â¢â¢

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone, well I managed to make the zap today. Don't feel as bad and nearly everyone waiting was snuffing and snivelling. Another day with a bunch of flowers too. Apparently Sainsburys donate them. They are yesterdays date on them so they're not allowed to sell them...... I'm not going to eat them so they should be ok! What a lovely idea. I used to work in a supermarket where they just threw out of date flowers in the bin. I got a beautiful bunch of pink lilies and half are not even open yet. 2 days off now and they're going to tag my missed day on the end so 30th Dec finish now hopefully. Someone rang the bell today and everyone clapped and some had tears I felt really happy for him. I wouldn't do it after chemo but might now after rads. xx
Posts.Title: â¢â¢â¢ December Radiotherapy Club â¢â¢â¢

Posts.Content: Hi, 7 down and 8 to go!Â  The bell was rung 4 times today with people finishing treatment. One was a lady about 26 year old and she brought her toddler of about 2 and her partner.The toddler rang the bell, the partner was crying and she was beaming from ear to ear and loads of photos were taken. I spoke to her after and she was lovely and so relieved... no further treatment after chemo/surgery/rads.....I never realised I could be so happy for other people I'm usually a bit self-centred if I'm honest! xx
Posts.Title: â¢â¢â¢ December Radiotherapy Club â¢â¢â¢

Posts.Content: Hi Mira and everyone, Well Mira they did tell me today about using the cream for 6-8 weeks after treatment finishes. So far everything has been fine but she said it looked a little red around my scar so they gave me a dressing which you just splash a little water on and place over the spot that's sore... it doesn't feel sore but I've put it on anyway... it doesn't stick down your bra just holds it in place unless like me your scar goes up your armpit lol.It's reusable for 7 days you just re-hydrate it when it needs.Marvellous. It annoyed me after 10 mins so off it came and back to the cream which has worked well so far.You can't put cream on when using it - well after 13 zaps and only 2 to go I'm not giving up my cream...so there! Everyone I've got to know at the sessions all finish tomorrow so there will be a lot of bell ringing! Cos I missed a day I go over to 2nd Jan for my last zap.Imagine I might be the first all the new patients hear.That bell will be like clanging like mad. Hope everyone just starting are doing ok and we all have a happy and healthy new year. xx
Posts.Title: â¢â¢â¢ December Radiotherapy Club â¢â¢â¢

Posts.Content: Hi Kim, I had never heard of the bell thing. It was on my first day of chemo and I heard this thing clanging away,everyone clapping and taking group photos with the chemo nurses. So when I asked what was going on a lovely nurse said after FEC treatment is finished you ring the bell and tell cancer to Fec Off. I really laughed,but when I finished couldn't bring myself to do it as it seemed like tempting fate. I'm at a different hospital for my rads and the bell is right next to the reception..so maybe it's an American thing starting hereÂ  don't know or it might have been going for years. I'm the same as you since chemo started I don't have any sweat and don't use anything and honestly I don't think I smell lol. So far the cream I said they gave me seems to be working I slap it on as soon as I get home and shove an old t-shirt on so not ruining clothes-then more just before bed and once a week I use Udderly Cream as a complete body moisturiser... I was never a daily person I always forget. Just cancelled my 30th Dec appt and made it for 2nd Jan now . After getting zapped today went to see my grand-daughter as she's 2 year old today. I bought her a dolls pram and doll and made the mistake of saying lets take all the dollys for a walk (meaning pushing round the house)Nooooo the coat and wellies came out and ended up taking her to the park..but made my day it was lovely. Anyway I'll stop rambling now... speak to you all soon and good luck everyone, xx
Posts.Title: â¢â¢â¢ December Radiotherapy Club â¢â¢â¢

Posts.Content: Mira, Those blue lights made me laugh! I never thought how ringing the bell might help others but I think you are right. Every session so far people are ringing it and it does make me feel happy for them so I think I will, thank you for a different view on it. Good tip too about putting it on a month after as no-one has mentioned this.Been ok so far .When I was showering this morning my nipple was sore underneath and I could feel a lump ...panic mode started...My tumour was in my armpit so first thought was have they missed this because of concentrating on the armpit. Told them at the zap session and they said it was just scar tissue forming from my ops and the rads hardening it... nothing to worry about! Will see how it goes and contact bcn if get too worried. Good luck to you to and everyone else. xx
Posts.Title: â¢â¢â¢ December Radiotherapy Club â¢â¢â¢

Posts.Content: Thank you so much Lynn. That explains it much better.Yes I am on aÂ  plan. I started FEC on 9th June (had 2 cycles so far) having 3 of these then having withÂ Herceptin and Perjeta for 4 cycles.I am having chemo first then surgery and radiotherapy.Had a node biopsy where they removed 3 but thankfully they were all clear.Â They have mentioned 14 more Herceptin but am not sure over what period of time. I wasn't thinking that far in advance when they told me so I have forgotten.Will ask at next appointment. No wonder they told me to come on this site.... the info and friendship is amazing. xx
Posts.Title: Diagnosis.. what does it mean?

Posts.Content: Hi All, Well I had to miss only my 5th zap today as I have the dreaded lurgy! I have been a snotty nose all week but felt ok to go but woke up this morning and felt like the T truck had found me again! Anyway called the hospital and they were fine,stay in bed and see how it goes. I was worried about missing a session but she said they don't like you to but they will squeeze me an extra one in either Saturday or just add one at the end. So stayed in bed all day in fact only got up at 4pm...then they called and said could I come in at 7pm as they had a cancellation. No way could I go but she said no problem so still going in tomorrow. It's not having the cold so much it's just I can't hold my breath as my chest is so tight. Nothing is straightforward for me lol. xx Oh and nearly all my fingernails have now come off..can't even push a tablet out the packet I have to cut them out! PN doesn't help. This gift so keeps on giving but I'll take it all and then some and when it's over I'm going to go up you cancer! xx
Posts.Title: â¢â¢â¢ December Radiotherapy Club â¢â¢â¢

Posts.Content: Thanks ever so much. They removed 3 nodes in sentinel biopsy and none showed signs of cancer.Does the 80% mean anything? My head is racing with life expectancy etc. I've not googled anything as both my bcn and surgeon told me not to...they just said come on this site only. I am obsessed with cancer at the moment.. it's all I seem to think ofÂ morning,noon and night.Hopefully that will get better. xx
Posts.Title: Diagnosis.. what does it mean?

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone, I start my rads on Friday 8th Dec. Went to an arm exercise class the other day but nothing was mentioned about creams. I read the radiotherapy tips forum on here and saw all the different suggestions but the query I have is do I put cream on BEFORE rads or just after? Thanks for any help xx
Posts.Title: â¢â¢â¢ December Radiotherapy Club â¢â¢â¢

Posts.Content: Hi All, Had my first rads this morning. I just showered and used nothing.My appointment was 11.15am and I was out after about 20 mins,she said the first one was a bit longer as they were doing some measurements and the next lot should only be about 5 mins! I was given a gown (well just to waist) like a tabard, zips down front and Velcro on sleeves so you just undo which boob you're having done, which I keep for all my sessions so it's my own personal one. I was given a large tub of Aquamax which she said I can use before rads as it's the only one doesn't affect results,just a thin coat before then after slather it on at least twice but only use on treatment not as a general moisturiser. I said I had got pure aloe vera and she said use it anywhere else if you have dry skin but not on treatment site?? She also said the rads would kick in after about a week (skin wise) but if the Aquamax doesn't work they have other stuff, but most people don't have a problem and they thinks it's the best. I never mentioned R1 or 2 as I thought I'd save that for if there is a problem.Have to say they were lovely and helpful. We will see how it goes and I'll let you know. xx
Posts.Title: â¢â¢â¢ December Radiotherapy Club â¢â¢â¢

Posts.Content: Hello Zelda, I'm afraid I am not as patient and understanding as a lot of people on this site(which you did say in your post on the room you were leaving?) but I have watched and read your posts for a long time now and I honestly believe that you need help of a psychiatric nature. Gragon and others have spoken so kindly and patiently to you but I get the strong impression that you do not want to help yourself at all and before anyone jumps in and condemns me I suggest you read all of Zelda's posts. You jump from forum to forum with the same thing and I know I don't have to read it but at first I was very concerned and worried for you but some of the things you have said about your son are despicable even if he has schizophrenia and I believe you continue because no one stands up to you for fear of looking bad, but I don't think like that. Yes your problems seem to be bad but only you can do anything about them and I am in no way referring here to your cancer diagnosis but to your general outlook on life. It is obvious you are an intelligent woman and you may have a mental health problem which I know you can get lots of help for. I have been in some dark places in my time but never have I seen anyone as bad as you...everything seems to be the 'worst case scenario'. I really do hope you seek some help and get some more trust in doctors and those trying to help you. Yes we are all free to rant on here but I hope we listen to what others say to us, maybe not now but in the future, you have had some excellent advice from better people than me and I do feel for you, what worries me is that you are talking at times suicidal and that I find very concerning. I know you don't like hugs so I will just send you my best regards and hope you find what you are looking for someday.
Posts.Title: problems with adjuvant therapy

Posts.Content: Morning to All, Just received a copy of letter from oncologist to gp.Although she has explained everything quite clearly to me all the way along I am not sure what this means on the letter: Diagnosis: screen detected left breast cancer M5 22mm U5 24mm Axilla A3 Grade 3 ductal carcinoma ER7/8 Her2 positive K167 80% It's the M5 U5 ER7/8 K167 80%Â Â  I am not sure of. Can anyone give me a clue as I don't see oncologist now until September. Thanks.
Posts.Title: Diagnosis.. what does it mean?

Posts.Content: Your index of stuff helped so much. Also saw my bn today and she was so helpful in explainingÂ everything to me.It has been hectic last few days having bone scan/ct scan/boob and heart ultrasounds/ecgs/ blood tests etc etc I probably don't need to name them all as you all know them.Told today am having sentinel node surgery on 2nd june then chemo starting 16th providing all is well from scans. Meeting oncologist on 24th and surgeon on 26th may. I was scared it was all so fast but now I am glad and to be honest just want to get on with it.Will be having Herceptin and perjeta so will welcome any info on this. Been offered cold cap but decided not to have this as I am a wimp and can't stand an ice cream pain let alone this!That is all I know sorry for going on x
Posts.Title: Thank you dreamthief

Posts.Content: Oh and don't rub it after as that's when it bruises apparently and use a different spot each time. xx
Posts.Title: Filgrastim injections

Posts.Content: Hi collies, sorry to butt in but just wanted to tell you what mine were like. It's in a spring thingy so when you grab a layer of stomach(I had a lot to grab) when you put it in and press it springs back to let you know it's done. They did tell me to pull it out slowly and as I said before I didn't have a problem and I was dreading it! Good luck but you'll be fine. xx
Posts.Title: Filgrastim injections

Posts.Content: Hi Scarlettem, I had chemo on a Friday and had the injections from Sunday for 7 days and can honestly say it was the only part of this whole business that never gave me any side effects, I was fine. We are all so different it's unbelievable. When they first said I had to do them myself I was like oh nooo I can't, but it was a long wait for a nurse to come. The first day I stood with injection in hand, no I can't, oh get on with it! and I jabbed it in. Felt no pain and felt like a wuzz for worrying. One thing they did tell me was when you take them out of fridge(they are stored there) warm them up in room temperatureÂ  for 20 mins before injecting. Even when I get my Herceptin injection they give it to me to warm up in my hands first. Hopefully you'll be the same. Good luck. xx
Posts.Title: Filgrastim injections

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, Excuse me while I rant a little. Tomorrow have an apt with the onc , results of bone and heart scans, as some of you know I have had chemo/surgery/rads/Herceptin injections but when she put me on letrozole I had a severe skin reaction (still have scarred hands) so before I had my rads on 8th Dec she gave me a 'drug holiday' as she put it. Well I am going to tell her tomorrow that,apart from Herceptin injections) I want no more drugs. Drugs that thin my bones,drugs that counteract those drugs but cause jaw necrosis. No I want a bit of quality in my later years. For the first time in months I feel a little like the 'old' me. I have done hours of research, mainly on NICE and feel for me this is the best option but I know she will fight tooth and nail for me to continue, she said I could try anastrazole and skip the biophosphonates... what is the point then? Anger because apart from my first chemo I have gone through all the treatment alone. I just phoned my son and asked if he would come with me tomorrow as last time my dil accused me of being negative when I told her they had found microscopic nodules in my lungs said I exaggerated things for the worse. So I said if he came he could hear first hand all the results,prognosis etc (they know I am refusing AI). He can't come because dil can't look after 2yr old and baby on her own yet! For an hour! But she went out with both to her friends this afternoon.I am so angry I could burst. I was told to come round to theirs after apt and tell them all about it.Well God help anyone who say's the wrong thing this time! As always thanks for listening. xx
Posts.Title: Bit Scared and a Lot Angry

Posts.Content: Early morning hello, Thank you Maria, Helen,mrsox and Optimistic for your kind words and thoughts. You are all right in what you say, I especially love the changing of the will! I went back into my shell just after I posted as I was so angry and upset, especially when I got sent loads of pictures of the day at friends. I cried for the first time since my last melt down a few months ago.Tried all the techniques my psycho told me to do when stressed then took myself off to bed.....couple of hours sleep and here I am now wide awake, mulling over what you all have said. So now sod it .... I'm just going to get on with it as usual.Keep that dignified silence and when I get home tomorrow going to book a little holiday in the sun and spend the inheritance! What would we do without each other, the only people who understand what's going on. Thank you xx
Posts.Title: Bit Scared and a Lot Angry

Posts.Content: Oh my lovely friends, went to apt no onc as she's on holiday just a registrar,but she was very well informed so no complaint there.My heart scan was fine over 57% and bone density showed slight ostopoenia at base of my spine, in other words old age.We discussed in great length about AI's and I told her I didn't want anything more..she said they knew I was going to say that and onc had left a message that it was up to me... we discussed recurrence and she said having the AI didn't have any proof yet about this, which I knew from researching NICE guidelines..in fact she said you've done your homework! As I was going and putting my coat on she said what's wrong with your arm..been sore for about 10 days.. orders a bone scan straight away..omg says me.. not a secondary... she says probably not but we'll do a bone scan just to check but unfortunately there's a backlog so no scan till 28 Feb.. so scanxiety now. I went HOME straight after as was crackered by then anyway ..3 hours after I said I would be at sons he phoned to ask where was I and what was the results!! I said if you'd come you would have known but then I did my usual...everythings fine...said about arm and scan and heard dil in background say oh that's good news could I have 2 yr old for a couple of hours tomorrow. As I love my grand-daughter I said yes obviously but I realise how selfish they are now.It's when it suits them.. I hate to say it because I know they love me but they are so thoughtless. Anyway, was so knackered after lack of sleep last night..fell asleep in chair from 4pm until 7pm and then been looking at holidays then fell asleep again!! So that's me for the night! Thank you all for your love and concern it's more appreciated than you will ever know. xx PS.... referring me to a dermatologist for the scarring on my hands from letrozole reaction...also said rads side effects come out about 4-6 weeks after finishing that's why I suddenly feel tired....not the lack of sleep then??
Posts.Title: Bit Scared and a Lot Angry

Posts.Content: I am coming to the end of treatment just 4 more Herceptin injections to go. Can anyone tell me when the yearly mammograms start. Is it from diagnosis date? surgery date? or all clear date. I've been meaning to ask onc but keep forgetting! xx
Posts.Title: Screening once treatment is all finished

Posts.Content: Morning All, I wasn't worried about my knickers more worried about taking my upper dentures out!Â  I can't talk very clearly without them and feel very self conscious but the theatre staff were lovely (well used to it). I kept my teeth in right up toÂ being knocked out which meant I could answer all the check questions loud and clear. I was told to bring dressing gown and slippers in as I would walk to theatre but in the end I was wheeled in my bed.Had the lovely disposable knickers,arms were removed from gown (not once was I exposed) then had a lovely warm blanket put over me. Next stop recovery room .. all done. Hope all goes well for everyone.
Posts.Title: Modesty during surgery

Posts.Content: Well done you xx I had lots of scarves and a wig at the ready but actually decided to do the bald look. I found I had more 'pity eyes' when I wore the scarves! Now me and my bald(and I mean shiny bald lol) head don't give it a second thought. I was waiting to go into chemo the other week and there were 2 ladies talking. One had a scarf on and the other a wig(she said so)...both said they go bald at home but keep hats by the front door as they would never let anyone see them bald, I thought that was a bit sad as you are still you, but I know we are all different.The best was neither of them acknowledged my presence but spoke to all the ladies with scarves asking where they got them! Still trying to work out if I should be insulted or not lol. xx
Posts.Title: No headscarf

Posts.Content: Hi all, I went to 2 different hospitals, 1 for chemo and other for RT, both had bells on the wall. I didn't ring the chemo bell as I felt like it was tempting fate as Sophie 236 says, but I did ring after RT, loud and long! . I think it gives a bit of hope to others hearing it that the end is in sight. So yes, push the ceo for that bell. xx
Posts.Title: A Bell To Ring

Posts.Content: Hi Christina100, Read my profile..Stage 3 grade 3 and I'm still here! All the scans are necessary to see what's going on and what course of treatment you'll be having. I know it's scary but try and go one day at a time and don't overthink things. Have you got a treatment plan yet? Do you know what type of bc you have? her2+ or anything else? Lots of people on here with similar, keep posting and let us know what's happening..it's a huge shock, stay clear of googling. xx
Posts.Title: Breast cancer stage 3

Posts.Content: Thanks Lynne, I had to do a bit of a 'pineapple' head last night just to ease it a bit. So today I am going to shave it off.Never knew hair could cause pain! Will let you know later how it went. Thanks again
Posts.Title: Scalp pain and impending hair loss

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone and thanks for your replies. Well my son got the clippers out, he's an expert as he is clipped to the scalp lol. Even as I took my hair down it was so sore I just held it while he chopped with scissors and almost instantly the pain eased. My scalp was too tender so he did a No 2 shave and then today it was painfree so got the No 1 which has left a small fuzz covering. I am actually amazed how much it suits me! Went shopping today but wore a hat and wrap but think I will go without next time as I found people looking and I felt a little like a 'victim' as my family said people who know you know its you and sod everyone else! Plus side it was nice to get up this morning and not have to faff about blow-drying my hair! Also noticed my pubic hair has gone too-must have gone in shower this morning and I hardly noticed lol. Got my 2nd cycle on Friday and a bit apprehensive that things get worse but I am always a 'half full glass' person. No doubt I will be back here as reading the posts is so inspiring and helpful.
Posts.Title: Scalp pain and impending hair loss

Posts.Content: Hi , I was looking through posts as my scalp is so sore at the moment. I had my first chemo on 9th June and have been fine , waiting for all the side effects and haven't had any so far... no nausea etc ..then yesterday the 22nd almost 2 weeks later washed my hair and noticed loads of loose hairs in the towel,on the brush and if I breathe they are falling out everywhere! But today my scalp from the crown to my forehead is so sore it feels like sunburn.. is this 'normal'? It really is so sore.
Posts.Title: Scalp pain and impending hair loss

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, well I went to collect my wig today. It was so me... I was so pleased I actually left it on after the fitting and went shopping! That is an enormous step for me as I said I would never wear it! Best bit was it was raining and my usual hair does a frizz but my wig looked fab .. trying to see the plus side of all this and I have to laugh at how I feel.. from negative to positive in so many easy steps.My lovely wig fitting lady said 'Go for it' as most people take it home in the box.I seem to have gone from a shrinking violet who bought loads of hats and scarves to a 'sod it' I am bald like it or lump it person.Think I will probably wear the wig for a 'special occasion' but honestly I am going bald as I went shopping in Asda the other day with my scarf on and i could see the 'poor you' looks and when I went bald in there no one gave me a second glance! I am a newbie though and have my second cycle on Friday 30th so who knows how I will feel after..... as brave as I sound I am scared.... I seem to have got through the first cycle ok and that worries me .. is the worse to come.. but I am determined to take it day by day....sorry for going on as I know I am lucky compared to some of you brave ladies x
Posts.Title: Scalp pain and impending hair loss

Posts.Content: Last year a work colleague lost her sister to BC. She did the campaign then and I was one of the people who sponsored her and I did think she was 'brave' doing it but only in respect that it was something I could never do personally.I never once thought of the people with cancer going through chemo just that we were raising money for macmillan research, which I believe is hugely important. If truth was told we also had a morbid curiosity to see what she looked like bald (sorry). I thought you get cancer, have chemo, go bald, throw up and then you are cured. How wrong was I. A year later I have breast cancer and am the bald person and I would never want anyone to shave their hair on my behalf.I would rather an advert that raised all the side effects of chemo and help the money go to researching new chemo with less effects. I was utterly ignorant of the things people had to go through, I didn't even know you lost all body hair, let alone the nail problems,neuropathy etc etc. So surely raising more awareness in this respect is needed. I understand people wish to raise money in their own way but this campaign does trivialise what we go through and obviously macmillan have not learnt how people feel from last year.Â  If anyone asks me if I have 'braved the shave' I am going to strip naked and say yes everywhere! xx
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Hi Phaedra, I refused to take them and any AI for similar reasons as you've put.That was after all my treatment finished and I started to feel 'human' again, if I was younger I might have taken a different path. My onc tried to persuade me to take them but when I asked her for the % benefit she had to admit it was minimal. I just didn't like the idea of taking tablets that thin my bones and then more to try and sort them out after with the risk of jaw necrosis. I wanted some quality to my life. I've had 2 bone scans since refusing and so far both show just very slight osteoporosis at the base of my spine which they say is an age thing anyway and is exactly the same as the scan I had prior to treatment starting. I have an apt to see onc on Wednesday so will let you know what the onc says but any decision you make is yours and you must be happy and comfortable with it. I am with mine including the chance of recurrence which she actually told me was not an exact science anyway. I did a lot of research before I came to my decision too. We are all different and I hope you choose whats best for you. Good luck. xx
Posts.Title: Anyone refused to take bisphosphonates?

Posts.Content: Hello Pointer, sorry to hear your diagnosis, but at least you know what's happening now. Will you be having chemo or radiotherapy too? Lots of lovely people on here and they will be along soon. Keep on posting and good luck with everything. xx
Posts.Title: Diagnosed Today

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone, I want chemo curls! 3 months post chemo now and I look like Jose Maurinho (football fella) or others say like Robert in Coronation Street! It's silver (I was before chemo) but straight as anything. I do love having to do nothing to it just wash in shower and towel dry, but I actually used a brush this morning - first time since June! even though it was a babies brush lol. Everyone saying I should keep it short as it suits me.. I had a shoulder length bob before ... then they tell me I look like 2 men!Â  xx
Posts.Title: Embracing chemo curls

Posts.Content: Hi All, Well I lied a bit in the title but just wanted a happy news thread! My happy news is I am happy! Been to hell and back and still here..if you told me 3 months ago I would be ok I would have said ### off! My bcn phoned me today and even she said you sound more positive..she knew me before and during my meltdownÂ  and you know what I am from my posts. Told her I didn't regret refusing AI's or biophosthingysÂ  even if it gives me 5years before recurrence to feel like me .. she said you'll probably get 10 years and I agree with you it's all about quality of life. Best was I had to phone local council about something and lady on phone said 'only pensioners are entitled to that' I said I am a pensioner and she said 'oh sorry you sound so young'...made my day and year! Anyway just wanted to say to anyone new it does get better. xx
Posts.Title: Happy News .. for a change

Posts.Content: Hi Ajmart, I finished my RT on 2nd Jan and after about 3 weeks noticed my boob was smaller. Never thought anything of it, when I went for my checkup appt a couple of weeks ago the RT consultant matter of factly said had I noticed it.... apparently it's common and permanent. Mine's probably only obvious to me I only noticed when I was rubbing cream in.. my bra's don't look any different with my largeish boobs in!Â  Hope this helps. xx
Posts.Title: One smaller boob after radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi,I am due to have a picc inserted on Thurs(20th) the day before my 3rd cycle of fec. I am terrified and was just about to phone and cancel. My problem is... I haven't had any so far with the last cannulas so should I tempt fate? If I cancel can I still get it done at a later date if needed? Also the idea of having to go weekly to hospital is putting me off as well as the idea that I have this 'thing' dangling from my arm.I really don't know what to do.
Posts.Title: Blood Clot in PICC line

Posts.Content: Thank you all for your replies. I'm afraid I have cancelled my appointment but they reassured me I can change my mind at anytime I want so am going to see how it goes. I don't think it's the picc line as such I am afraid of it's the local anaesthetic. After my core biopsy and sentinel biopsy I had a severe reaction to the 'local'..... it was awful, as if acid had been poured inside me.I spent about 3 hours in the recovery room being given every painkiller going... it took about 4 hours before the pain went. I have been trying to find out since what they used so I can avoid it,but no one will tell me. I will be asking further when I go on Friday.It's a different hospital to go to for the picc line and they said it was an injection so that was a no straight away.Â  Will see if my veins behave! Thanks again for all your advice. x
Posts.Title: Blood Clot in PICC line

Posts.Content: Hi mamasatch, I am ER+8 and PR+8 and HER2+ I was at the oncologist yesterday as I didn't want to take any AI like anastrazol she explained the numbers.On a scale of 1-8 is the amount of aggressiveness of the hormone receptors not the cancer itself, so as I am 8 she said I was the highest risk of these cells producing oestrogen which the cancer can feed off and therefore put you at more risk of an earlier recurrence. In fact it was the amount of detail she gave that actually made me change my mind and take the hormonal therapy treatment. Dreamthief is the person for this sort of thing as he is a marvel with the stats. I don't know how to tag but hopefully someone else can. xx
Posts.Title: ER8. PR8

Posts.Content: Good Morning Everyone, Well thought I'd post some happy news for a change,hope it doesn't tempt fate. Since having the paclitaxel last week I haven't had 1 side effect! Nothing, zero, zilch..... I was waiting for something to happen especially after such a hard time on the docetaxol, but it actually is the best I have felt since starting chemo.My taste buds are back .. tea tastes lovely again. I know its early days but will make the most of it while I can. Hope all is going well for everyone. xx
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Good Morning All, I am awake a little due to my own fault and some due to chemo. Won't go into details as its all in August chemo thread, but after 3Fec (which were ok) and 1 Docetaxol (which sent me to hospital) my onc has switched me to weekly paxlitaxel for 8 weeks (apparently equivalent to the 3 more docetaxol I would have had).So I had my first one today,but didn't realise with having the Herceptin and perjeta (still every 3 weeks) it would take 5 hours,so by the time I got home at 4.30pm I was cream crackered.Thought I'll have a little granny nap and woke up at half past midnight - hence wide awake now. Still at least no steroids or filgristim needed on the weekly dose.Pain going weekly but if it avoids all the SE it's worth it. Only time will tell - will keep you informed and good luck to the ladies trying cold cap I was too much of a wimp! Love to you all xx ps. stick with it...my ultrasound last week showed no trace of the tumour it had shrunk so much.
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Hi Horsemad, Glad that you have joined us here in the chemo group you are more than welcome. I couldn't even try the cold cap the thought of it was enough as I go mad with a 2 second brain freeze from an ice cream! I lost my hair after 1st round of FEC... have a wig never wear it, I go 'au natural' most of the time except when its cold I wear a scarf. I have my naps during the day too, sometimes I can still sleep at night but I don't worry anymore if I am awake I just read a little and never look at the time ( I read once that was the worst thing to do as your brain starts thinking nooooo only so long to sleep) and then its a vicious circle..... it seems to work somehow. Keep well and keep in touch with the club. xx
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Hi All, Went for my 2nd week of paxlitaxel earlier today and as soon as I said to the nurse my hands and feet were numb and tingling she was off to speak to the onc. Onc said no chemo today (this is still effects from docetaxol) and she wants to meet me next week to decide whether to continue or not. I told the nurse I had already decided to ask to stop chemo as I don't want to end up with numb hands and feet and this is getting worse not better.Quality of life is very important to me, it does help to know that my tumour has shrunk so hopefully they will go straight for the lumpectomy now. I feel very well so it's a bit like being given a weeks holiday.... going to have my 21month grand daughter to stay overnight tomorrow to make up for all the times been to ill to have her even for an hour. Will let you know whats happening next week. xx
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Hi All, Just a bit of an update since my last post on the 8th. Well I had my g-daughter overnight and it was the best medicine anyone can have .. I have never laughed so much... she is the joy of my life. So glad I had the chance because how quickly things can change in this game! Went for cycle on 15th and no chemo again.. onc said we might have to stop but she is on holiday next week so to have that one then we will review when she gets back. On the 17th rushed into hospital with chest pains and,cut a long story short, have a blood clot on my lung.Given blood thinners and scans to confirm but no chemo again this week(22nd) so that's 3 missed now and I still have the neuropathy! So I definitely think I will be leaving the chemo club. I don't know what's happening to me but I haven't stopped crying since I came out of hospital on Thursday afternoon.Had a panic attack yesterday afternoon too,haven't had one for years. xx
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Hi All, Well I have to leave the chemo club... my onc has decided that she can't risk making my neuropathy any worse so she has stopped the last 3 weekly cycles of paclitaxel.She seems to think that the tumour has shrunk enough already and then she brought the breast surgeon in who agreed with her... so no more chemo just the Herceptin injections, all18 of them, and surgery as already booked in November, then radiotherapy. She did say she would fit me in earlier if she could. I am glad in some ways as I don't want to end up with permanently numb hands and feet, but I feel 'robbed' in other ways that I didn't get to fight the cancer right to the end of chemo, but I gave it my all even when I was really ill. So good luck to all of you with your chemo cycles, I hope all goes well. xx
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Fran, When your hubby gets home stick his head in your smelly armpit and hold it there!Â  Seriously though I get this now and again and also a 'chemical' smell I can't describe for a few days after chemo. I am forever asking family if the house smells lol. Good luck to you for the future and I agree... take no crap! xx
Posts.Title: Update on my cancer

Posts.Content: Hi, I was similar to Leolady. I had a chin length bob, day 12/13 after first chemo it started to come out. It got really sore so I got my son to shave it off right down to a little fuzz and then it all fell off and I was a baldie. I never wore hats or scarves, I embraced the bald. Nobody batted an eyelid and never got any pity looks. 3 months after chemo it was back, same silver grey colour but looked like a demented poodle, straight at the back and curly on top. So went for my first haircut. Had a couple since then and in fact going for a cut tomorrow. Good luck with chemo, hope all goes well for you. xx
Posts.Title: Hair cut due, what to do?

Posts.Content: Thank you much appreciated xx
Posts.Title: Indexed Terms and Abbreviations Dictionary For Everything BC Related...

Posts.Content: Hi Peanut, Coconut water, ice lollies and soup got me through. I love my cuppa but couldn't stand it during chemo... tea back to normal now and well still have the others ..just in case ( any excuse). Good luck xx
Posts.Title: Drink

Posts.Content: Lou1234 Welcome, Some great advice given, good luck with your treatment and keep posting. xx
Posts.Title: Hello, I’m new to this and would love a friendly hello

Posts.Content: . Â  xx
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: Hi Gummybear1, I presume you are talking about the 3 weekly injections? I am on the 12 of 18 and have had no problems or side effects at all, hope you will be the same. xx
Posts.Title: starting herceptin

Posts.Content: Thank you Michael that really clarifies things. The thread is 2 years old I don't know why it was brought back xx
Posts.Title: Dangerous internet information

Posts.Content: Morning Everyone, Feel a bit of a fraud being on here as so many of you are suffering far more than me but I just need a moany moment. Had first cycle of FEC on 9th June and apart from a couple of days of nausea and constipation felt ok. Then hair started to come out (no big deal for me I know it is for others).Had my 2nd cycle on Friday 30th June and feel like I've been hit by a truck!Â Was ok until the next day.Â Nausea is awful and diarrhoea at least 10 times since. So cold and just no energy whatsoever.. its an effort to get off the chair but trying not to take to my bed! As for sleep had 2 hours in 24. Was so worn out by last night I took codydramol to knock me out and it did so last night I actually slept and feel so much better today. Yesterday was the lowest, I sat in the garden and sobbed my eyes out... no specific reason just cried.Not usually a moany person but never felt like this before.Didn't want to call my family as I was at theirs on Sunday when I was bad and don't want to keep burdening them... so I felt so alone. Thanks for listening..apologies for being a wimp x
Posts.Title: *** July 2017 Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi All me again, Well the Imodium worked so well I have had 3 days now of bad constipation! Without meaning to be rude, really bad, can hardly walk,Â like a tree trunk stuck up my bum!! Took some constipation tablets, didn't work, so thought what usually gives me the 'runs' ...eggs. Can't stand them but anything is better than this. 2 boiled eggs for lunch and wow! mount etna (sorry). Thank God I live in a bungalow would never make it upstairs, but the difference it has made! Today I actually feel like a human being. I find this diarrhoea/constipation more debilitating than the actual chemo. Hope not put anyone off eggs lol
Posts.Title: *** July 2017 Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Thank you all for your kind replies.... really made me feel better.I was advised to get Imodium and so far (touch wood) it seems to be working.Still feel weepy and so tired. Had to go out earlier and it was such an effort couldn't wait to get home. Thanks again x
Posts.Title: *** July 2017 Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Morning Kerry, 3am this morning I had the same conversation with myself! I can't do this anymore just kept going round and round in my head. Usually I am bad from day 3 onwards, but funnily enough was ok, tempted fate by saying so... then wham yesterday morning woke up with high temp, sore throat and awful diarrhea.Phoned emergency line who told me to call an ambulance straight away. Cut a long story short I ended up on an iv antibiotic, but amazingly my white cell count was high so they sent me home with a further course of antibiotics. Had the worse night so far. Terrible diarrhea,acid reflux and vomiting and as you said just feel awful.Felt sorry for myself and was crying all night.Joined the 'no sleep all night club'.Today is another day and I suppose I will just carry on, don't we all? Keep telling myself it's for the best and it won't last, but it's an awful feeling isn't it. I hope you're feeling a bit better, you're not alone. xx
Posts.Title: *** July 2017 Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Kerry and everyone, Eden hope your first chemo has gone well? I cried at my first when she brought the tubes of chemo out... it was suddenly real! Well I have been asleep most of the day...no doubt won't sleep tonight but I feel a lot better.My son called round before and I went into utter meltdown... crying 'I'm so sorry for all of this on you'Â  'I can't do this chemo anymore'... I could see my pain in his eyes. He hugged me... I cried even more but feel better for it as I think I've been trying too much to put a brave face on in front of family and this is the reality. Also got me thinking of all the people who have no-one at all, it must be so hard. Just him being here was reassuring and made things less scary.I even said when I am well again I am going to look into volunteering to see and help people who have absolutely no-one. Take care. xx
Posts.Title: *** July 2017 Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi to Everyone, Been for my 3rd cycle of FEC this morning.Got told off because I had not phoned triage after my last cycle when I had severe diarrhea for 3 days (I just thought that was the 'norm' but apparently if you go more than 6 times a day you should phone in) I know now and they gave me some tablets to take straight away to control it before it starts. They actually checked with consultant to see if I needed to reduce fec dosage but the 'lady from del monte' said no. I have developed peripheral neuropathy in my hands (they were blue and cold yesterday and tingling like mad) after 4 attempts to put the cannula in they tried a heat pad and another attempt no luck ...I feel like a pin cushion. I apologised for cancelling my picc line appt yesterday (reasons on that thread) again went to consultant and came back with ward sister who said we'll put it in 'bad' arm. I thought they didn't do this but she said it depends on how many nodes have been removed and the fact I only (only! lol) have 4 more fect to have.No need for picc she said we'll do this if needed.Said it was the neuropathy making me more sensitive and sore. It added almost an hour on being there but that's the way the cookie crumbles.At least I got soup and a roll x Feeling ok so far.... know it won't last I seem to be bad days 3-9 so no doubt I'll be back. Keep going everyone. xx
Posts.Title: *** July 2017 Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Kerry and everyone, Eden hope your first chemo has gone well? I cried at my first when she brought the tubes of chemo out... it was suddenly real! Well I have been asleep most of the day...no doubt won't sleep tonight but I feel a lot better.My son called round before and I went into utter meltdown... crying 'I'm so sorry for all of this on you'Â  'I can't do this chemo anymore'... I could see my pain in his eyes. He hugged me... I cried even more but feel better for it as I think I've been trying too much to put a brave face on in front of family and this is the reality. Also got me thinking of all the people who have no-one at all, it must be so hard. Just him being here was reassuring and made things less scary.I even said when I am well again I am going to look into volunteering to see and help people who have absolutely no-one. Take care. xx
Posts.Title: *** July 2017 Chemo Club ***
